ratings.comment: Most of the assignments are out of 3-5 points and he gives grades like 2.83/3. Then there will be a couple assignments worth 30% of the course grade. He's very arrogant, I showed his example slides/the way he required we design them to the people I work with and they said they looked like they were designed by a kid on the short bus.

If you want to get a lot out of this class take it with Mike. He knows what he's doing and I think prepares you for real world writing. However, if you're like most engineering students and you just want this class done, go to someone else if you can.

Mike is a very distinct type A personality and he really cares about his students. I think that teaching a bunch of engineers communication is bound to make some people frustrated, and I knew this going in--but still got frustrated with the workload. That said, learned a lot and grew as a communicator in ways that I can take into my career.
Dont take this class

It is obvious that Mike is an ego-driven maniac. Despite countless feedback on the workload, there has been no change to the assignment frequency, grading, or time commitment. Despite his drawbacks, Mike gives excellent, engaging, and thorough lectures and the knowledge I have gained is something I will take to my future career and beyond.

Mike defiantly gives you more work in his class than the other professors that teach 397. With his background as an English teacher he has a very unique and different way of approaching the class and he will grade you tough. If you want to get a lot out of the class take it with Mike, otherwise go another direction because it will be a lot of work.

Mike is genuinely a very nice and honest person. He is clearly very passionate about what he is teaching, and comes off as approachable. The dude responds to any message you send him on MS Teams (which he uses a lot) in like 20 minutes. The homework load isn't as bad as it apparently used to be, but he's a strict grader. Good guy, annoying class.

It is very evident Mike is a hyper-intelligent individual who cares deeply about the connections between engineering and technical writing. He creates excellent in class activities as well as challenges students to grow as writers and team members. However, Mike does not understand the level of work he assigns is far too much and long.

Mike is literally the biggest dweeb ever dude. 0/10...would not listen to his mind numbing lectures again. All jokes aside, he needs to get off his high horse and understand that nobody wants to take this class. Giving engineering students, who already have way too much on their plate, even more work has got to be his favorite pastime.

I heard some negative things about Prof. Shapiro before taking his course, but after completing it I'm glad that I did. I think he's made several changes to the course over the last couple years to give students a lot more work time, and less busywork. The class was over weeks before the end of the semester, with the remaining weeks for work time.

Mike is clearly very passionate about this subject and has put a lot of time into making this course what it is. However, he expects you to put a ridiculous amount of time and effort into this class. He makes it insanely difficult to get good grades and provides very critical, subjective and unhelpful feedback. Avoid him if you value your time.

Mike is a great guy. He really does care about his students. Problem is this class is for engineers. Engineers have a boatload of homework for their other classes. I hoped this would be a class where I could learn some aspects of communications and get a B with a little bit of effort. It's basically another engineering course and he grades HARD.

I can tell that Mike truly cares about his students and their success. Any time that there was an issue or a question he responded promptly and was very accommodating. That being said this class was a massive pain. He made a lot of different assignments that just felt like busy work most of the time. Additionally, he was an incredibly picky grader

Mike thinks this class is the most important class in the world, based on the amount of work he assigns. In this section, everyone already had jobs and passed interviews! I don't need to be graded by a random professor on my skills and waste time recording myself. What you learn in this class is common sense. He makes it so complicated. Terrible.

Mike assigns SO much busy work for a Summer class, it's comical. Instead of letting us work on more heavy assignments, there are ALWAYS filler assignments that take hours. He may think they are helpful, but lots of them are us doing his work for him (heavy peer reviews) and that time would better be spent doing anything else. He needs to chill.

As others have noted below, Mike does want to be helpful and give feedback. Problem is, it's nearly impossible to reach his standards? Spend hours and hours peer reviewing papers? Well, he's gonna dock you points for some mysterious reasons. He does seem like he has a superiority complex. He grades way too hard for a class no one cares about.

An unnecessarily difficult grader who cannot seem to comprehend that his methods are not the only correct ones. It is almost as if he has some sort of inferiority complex and expects students to write in a way such that can educate and interest both a child and an expert, which is not realistic.
Very tough grader Lots of work Great teacher though

There's a lot of work in 397, but Mike wants you to succeed and does everything he can to be a resource for you to do well. I found myself putting a lot of time in to this class because he motivated me to produce good work (and I can't say that for EPD instructors I've had in the past). Take advantage of conferences with him! He's great, 10/10.

Overall great instructor. Some things were confusing and not very well explained but if you schedule a meeting with him he will explain everything and help out a lot. If i had to take a class and he was an instructor I'd pick him. The riddles at the beginning of class were a nice way of easing into class

Mike was tremendous. He cared about his students and was available when I needed him to be. He taught his course well, but he especially taught me skills that will improve my writing in the future. Overall great guy, encouraged his students to think "outside of the box," and had meaningful assignments.
Mike is truly in love with what he does, and that makes his discussions positively enjoyable.

Mike does actually care, and thus is quite good.There are weekly discussion questions,but he will tell you what he wants on a paper, and does so quite directly.He will hold additional office hours around campus,which does make him more assessable.Among the better TAs, probably the best for this class. Would take him again.

I would have not enjoyed this class nearly as much as i did had it not been for Mike. He is very helpful and willing to listen whenever you want to bounce any ideas off him (like about papers)  At first i didn't like the idea of doing the weekly assignments, but take them seriously - practicing analysis there helped big time in the long run.
I really was not looking forward to this class but Mike made this class a positive experience!  He was really helpful and seemed to really enjoy what he was teaching!

Mike was a really good TA I thought, I thought that the journals once a week worked well because you had to think before you went to class, plus they only had to be one page, not that hard.  I thought he seemed to know his stuff really well.
Okay, so we're the only section who gets weekly papers...but how can you be mad at Mike?  It's MIKE!   I think he's really encouraging (good discussion atmosphere) and he certainly knows his stuff.
He is a very good TA!

He is a tough grader, but really focuses on learning.  Comics wouldn't be my choice for class topic, but it wasn't that painful. Class can get a little boring. Very nice guy who is very willing to help.
The subject is comic books. If you aren't insterested in it writing the papers will be difficult.  His guidelines are really unclear and he never really specifies what he wants from you.

Be ware of the topic that you will be discussing for the entire semester.I got stuck with comic books and it sucked ass.He can be confusing on what he wants out of you,but helpful if you take the time to ask him.No quizzes, just papers,the 10 page one definitely sucks!
I enjoyed the class, but I thought that he was better suited to one-on-one work rather than speaking to the group. I learned a lot more when we were discussing my papers than I learned in lecture.
